moves.4... Ng5: It jumps out of the way
moves.5. Nf3: I add another attacker forcing him to exchange and developing my queen
moves.5... Nxf3+ 6. Qxf3 f6: Trying to attack my pawn center but better might have been d6
moves.7. exf6: Would it have been better to let him capture first?
moves.7... Qxf6 8. Qxf6 gxf6: And by move eight the queens are traded off
moves.9. Nc3 Bb4 10. Bd2: I complete my minor piece development
moves.10... Bxc3 11. Bxc3 d5 12. O-O-O: With the queens off the board and a fair amount of material exchanged, I though my king would be better nearer the center.
moves.14... Rxh2 15. Rg8+ Kd7 16. Rd2: ?? And this is the blunder where I lose my bishop.
moves.16... Rxh7: He takes it and I am behind be four but he doesn't have any of his queenside pieces out so I don't resign.
moves.18. Bb4: I played this because it was a lot more active here than on c3
moves.19. Ba3 Bb7 20. Rdg2: I noticed the discovered attack and defended my rook but better would have been trading as this loses a pawn
moves.20... Nxd4 21. Rg2g7+ Rxg7 22. Rxg7+: Probably a bad exchange as I am behind
moves.30... Kc5 31. a4 Ne3: ?? This loses the knight and a pawn
moves.32. Bxd4+ Kb4 33. Bxe3 Kc3: The score is tied but it's only a matter of time before the BK picks of my pawns
moves.34. f5 exf5+: Skewers my king and bishop, but I can take his bishop
moves.35... Rxe3 36. Rxf5 Kxc2: And now he starts picking off my pawns
moves.38. Kxc7 Rb4 39. Rf6 b5: This forces the survival of one pawn
moves.40. axb5 Rxb5 41. Ra6 Kb3 42. Kc6: I keep playing hoping he'll make a mistake
moves.42... Kb4 43. Ra7 a4 44. Ra6: Just shuffling back and forth because I can't see anything better to do
moves.44... Rc5+ 45. Kb6 Rb5+ 46. Ka7: ?? This loses the game. I should have moved back to c6 and hoped for a draw by repetition, but this lets him force a rook trade.
moves.46... Ra5: And I resign because after the trade I can't stop him from promoting. As always, please comment if you see something that I didn't mention.
